result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher E McFarlane

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case cannot proceed to sentencing on today's date as State is in trial on an unrelated case.
Further, Court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Defense counsel has no objection to adjournment.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Christopher E McFarlane in court.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Christopher E McFarlane.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties in court to address warrant that was authorized on October 19, 2022.
Statements to the Court by defense counsel as to confusion by defendant after contact with Dept. of Corrections regarding the PSI.

Court vacates the bench warrant and reinstates bail.

Further:  Court reinstates JusticePoint monitoring; same conditions as previously imposed.

Case remains scheduled for sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Case called on the record at approx. 11:31 a.m.

Parties not in court.  Court is in receipt of Discharge Report from JusticePoint.
As defendant has not complied with conditions of bail, Court will issue warrant.

Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  Court orders bail to be forfeited.

Court orders hearing of October 25 remain on the court's calendar.

Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Discharge Report dated October 11, 2022 - received
Court will review
JusticePoint Violation Report dated September 27, 2022 - received
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State's request for bail modification granted by the Court:

Court MODIFIES conditions of bail as follows:

Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with anyone 16 years of age or younger
Defendant to turnover any passport (valid or expired) or travel documents to his counsel.  Counsel to not return to defendant without court order.

Room 620SB / 10:30

Defendant Christopher E McFarlane in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Matthew James Torbenson, appearing for Jack Eichorst, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

As to Count  1:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Counts  2, 3, 4, 5 and 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts  2, 3, 4, 5 and 6   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI ordered. Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  State is requesting remand.  Defense is requesting no remand.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will not remand defendant pending sentencing.

State requests bail modification.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated August 15, 2022 - received
Plea date scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher E McFarlane in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Both parties appear in person.  Jessica Birmingham (appears in person), practicing under the supervision of Jack T Eichorst, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests brief adjournment of today's scheduled plea hearing.
Further, defense counsel advises the Court they will be requesting a PSI at the plea hearing.
Court grants request and orders case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated July 11, 2022 - received

Defendant Christopher E Mcfarlane not in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense counsel filed a motion requesting an adjournment.  The matter was adjourned OFF THE RECORD.  The parties was notified via email.  The matter remains calendared in Branch 28.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter to Judge for Adjournment Received and Filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed

Defendant Christopher E Mcfarlane in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants defense motion to adjourn plea hearing as set forth in the record.  State's offer set forth in the record.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher E Mcfarlane in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Status Conference. Defense requests plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.

Defendant Christopher E Mcfarlane in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich; both appear in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  

This hearing will be streamed live on 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    42b75bd2-aff2-36d8-c51b-589000f427b0  

Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher E Mcfarlane in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Christopher E Mcfarlane in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher E Mcfarlane appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT HAS RETAINED PRIVATE REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
